page.title: 03GRANTHAM'S TWIN TOWN
page.content: {In recent years in Britain it has {become popular for towns and cities to {'Twin' with similar places abroad, {especially in Europe. Grantham is {twinned with the German town of Sankt {Augustin near the West German capital {Bonn. Each year for the last 6 years {several exchanges between groups have {taken place. 1985 saw a group of 42 {German scholars aged between 13 and 17 {from the Realshule Neiderpleis visit {Grantham. Whilst in the area they went {to several places of interest {including St Wulframs church, the {leisure centre etc. During their stay {they joined forces with their hosts {from St Wulframs school in the centre {of the survey area on a walking rally {which took them around and about the {town. The German teachers suggested a {return visit by Grantham children. { }
